metadata.title: CVE-2021-41687 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
DCMTK through 3.6.6 does not handle memory free properly. The programmalloc a heap memory for parsing data, but does not free it when error inparsing. Sending specific requests to the dcmqrdb program incur the memoryleak. An attacker can use it to launch a DoS attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41687` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dcmtk - 3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
libdcmtk16 - 3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dcmtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.6-5ubuntu0.1~esm1').
